summary: This bill, entitled the Smithsonian American Women's History Museum Act, authorizes the museum's location within the Reserve of the National Mall, overriding existing regulations. It amends previous legislation (Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021) regarding site selection and ensures diverse representation of women's experiences and viewpoints in exhibits and programs. The Secretary of the Smithsonian is required to report to Congress every two years on compliance with these diversity requirements.
